item.title: IP per Container with Calico CNI on DC/OS
item.description: Project Calico is a Layer 3 software defined network that runs well on DC/OS and Mesos. In this blog post we will walk through installing and configuring it on DC/OS 1.9. That will allow us to attach containers to Calico and receive unique IPs for them. We will also examine the security implications and policies that can be applied.

item.title: Compiling Local DC/OS Universe
item.description:
DC/OS offers its users the ability to install various frameworks with a single click from a central publicly hosted package repository called Universe.

Many Mesosphere clients run their DC/OS clusters in air-gapped environments with no access to the internet, thus not allowing for said one click installation of framework packages.

You can easily solve this problem if your DC/OS cluster is running in such a restricted environment.

item.title: Automating advanced DC/OS installation.
item.description: In this article we will look at automating the advanced DC/OS installation procedure. We will break down the requirements and look for opportunities to speed up the lengthy installation.

item.title: Using Jenkins with a private Docker registry on DC/OS
item.description: In this guide I will walk you through setting up your Jenkins instance to use the private docker registry we set up in the previous blog post.

item.title: Secure private Docker registry on DC/OS
item.description: This is a short guide on how to set up a private docker registry behind an internal marathon-lb instance all running on DC/OS. Since marathon-lb is a Layer 7 load balancer we will use it to terminate SSL for our private registry and avoid using it in insecure mode. We will use self-signed TLS certificates for that purpose.
